content.text: Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.1
Place the rod of clamp A, supporting the two springs, approximately \(65 \text{cm}\) above the bench
**Once fixed do not change the position of the rod of clamp A throughout the experiment.**
Suspend the wooden rod, with strings attached, using the springs as shown. Adjust the position of the rod of clamp B until the wooden rod is horizontal. Ensure the springs hang vertically
Measure and record the distance \(h_0\) between the centre of the rod of clamp B (supporting the single spring) and the bench
Add masses to the wooden rod as shown in Fig. 1.2. The \(100 \text{g}\) mass hanger should be attached to the longer, central string
Adjust the height of the rod of clamp B until the wooden rod is horizontal
Measure and record the distance \(h\) between the centre of the rod of clamp B and the bench, as shown in Fig. 1.3
Calculate the value of \((h_0 - h)\)
By increasing the mass \(m\), repeat **(b)(ii)**, **(b)(iii)** and **(b)(iv)** until you have five sets of values of \(m\) and \(h\). Do not change the mass attached to the longer, central string
Include values of \(\frac{(h_0 - h)}{m}\) and \(\frac{1}{m}\) in your table
Plot a graph of \(\frac{(h_0 - h)}{m}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(\frac{1}{m}\) on the \(x\)-axis
Draw the straight line of best fit
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line
gradient =
y-intercept =

where \(P\) and \(Q\) are constants
Use your answers in **(d)(iii)** to determine the values of \(P\) and \(Q\)
Give appropriate units

In this experiment, you will investigate how the extension of an arrangement of springs depends on the loads applied to it
Pour cold water into the beaker up to the \(200 \text{ml}\) mark
Pour the water into the cup and use the pen to place a mark on the inside surface of the cup, level with the water surface
Empty out the cold water
Repeat (a)(i), (a)(ii) and (a)(iii) for the bowl
Pour boiling water into the cup up to the mark
When the temperature of the water falls to approximately \(75^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\), start the stopwatch
Record this starting temperature \(\theta_0\)
After two minutes, measure and record the temperature \(\theta\)
Calculate the change in temperature \(\Delta \theta = (\theta_0 - \theta)\)
Measure and record the diameter \(d\) of the water surface
Estimate the percentage uncertainty in your value of \(d\)
percentage uncertainty =   .........
Repeat (b) and (c)(i) for the bowl
\(\theta =\)
d =
Using your data, calculate two values of \(k\)
first value of \(k =\)
second value of \(k =\)
Justify the number of significant figures that you have given for your values of \(k\)
Explain whether your results in (e)(i) support the suggested relationship
It is suggested that the relationship between \(\Delta \theta\) and \(d\) is
where \(k\) is a constant
Describe four sources of uncertainty or limitations of the procedure for this experiment
Describe four improvements that could be made to this experiment. You may suggest the use of other apparatus or different procedures
You may not need to use all of the materials provided
In this experiment, you will investigate how the cooling rate of a hot liquid depends on the surface area of the liquid exposed to air
